title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 ELIMINATION OF OPEN DEFECATION

description.narrative: Output 2 (Elimination of open defecation): National and subnational governments and partners have enhanced capacity to stimulate and sustain community behaviour change as part of the STBM focused on total sanitation and hygiene practice in communities, schools and health centres., which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys and their families, especially the most vulnerable, increasingly use safely managed and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, adopt critical hygiene practices, and live in resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2 (Elimination of open defecation): National and subnational governments and partners have enhanced capacity to stimulateand sustain community behaviour change as part of the STBM focused on total sanitation and hygiene practice in communities, schoolsand health centres.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical support, high-level advocacy both at national and sub national levels, and promoted learning and sharing to accelerate elimination of open defecation. By engendering wider consultations among all stakeholders to the Open Defecation free (ODF) roadmap formulation there is a collective commitment to end open defecation. Over 100,000 people now live in ODF villages in Aceh province through UNICEF’s support. By supporting analysis of WASH in Health facilities and in schools, UNICEF is helping prioritize investments to improve services. Alternative financing including the use of Islamic funds (e.g. ZIS) is being expanded to mobilize resources for the vulnerable. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/11/2021
